citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"9dc9c161-1cb3-45cd-a43c-232075a4b967\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}, {\"literal\": \"Tsleil-Waututh Nation\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"24\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Ce RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) a \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 le 2019-03-28 au Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet est un fjord c\u00f4tier du sud-ouest de la Colombie-Britannique. Cet instrument est un Profileur Acoustique de Vitesse par Effet Doppler 600 kHz. Les profileurs acoustiques de vitesse par effet Doppler (ADCP) sont des instruments hydroacoustiques, semblables aux sonars. Les ADCP mesurent simultan\u00e9ment la vitesse et la direction du courant \u00e0 plusieurs profondeurs pr\u00e9d\u00e9termin\u00e9es. Les ADCP utilisent l'effet Doppler des ondes sonores qui sont dispers\u00e9es par des particules dans l'eau de mer sur une plage de profondeur. Il a \u00e9t\u00e9 deploy\u00e9 sur une plateforme fixe. Les donn\u00e9es de ce d\u00e9ploiement sont archiv\u00e9es et accessibles sur l\u2019infrastructure num\u00e9rique Oceans 3.0 du R\u00e9seau Canadien des Oc\u00e9ans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualit\u00e9 et produits d\u00e9riv\u00e9s selon les conventions \u00e9tablies.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Burrard Inlet Profileur Acoustique de Vitesse par Effet Doppler 600 kHz d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 2019-03-28\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/9dc9c161-1cb3-45cd-a43c-232075a4b967?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"9dc9c161-1cb3-45cd-a43c-232075a4b967\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}, {\"literal\": \"Tsleil-Waututh Nation\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"24\"]}], \"abstract\": \"The RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) was deployed on 2019-03-28 at Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet is a coastal fjord in southwestern British Columbia. This device is a Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz. Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers (ADCP) are hydroacoustic instruments, similar to sonars. ADCPs measure current speed and direction at multiple predetermined depths simultaneously. ADCPs use the Doppler effect of sound waves that are scattered by particles in seawater over a depth range. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Burrard Inlet Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz Deployed 2019-03-28\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/9dc9c161-1cb3-45cd-a43c-232075a4b967?local=en\"}]

          <mcc:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>The EPSG Geodetic Parameter Dataset is a structured dataset of Coordinate Reference Systems and Coordinate Transformations, accessible through this online registry (www.epsg-registry.org) or, as downloadable zip files, through IOGP's EPSG home page at www.epsg.org.       <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>The RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) was deployed on 2019-03-28 at Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet is a coastal fjord in southwestern British Columbia. This device is a Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz. Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers (ADCP) are hydroacoustic instruments, similar to sonars. ADCPs measure current speed and direction at multiple predetermined depths simultaneously. ADCPs use the Doppler effect of sound waves that are scattered by particles in seawater over a depth range. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="fra">Ce RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) a été déployé le 2019-03-28 au Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet est un fjord côtier du sud-ouest de la Colombie-Britannique. Cet instrument est un Profileur Acoustique de Vitesse par Effet Doppler 600 kHz. Les profileurs acoustiques de vitesse par effet Doppler (ADCP) sont des instruments hydroacoustiques, semblables aux sonars. Les ADCP mesurent simultanément la vitesse et la direction du courant à plusieurs profondeurs prédéterminées. Les ADCP utilisent l'effet Doppler des ondes sonores qui sont dispersées par des particules dans l'eau de mer sur une plage de profondeur. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>
      <mri:status>
        <mcc:MD_ProgressCode codeList="http://standards.iso.org/iso/19115/resources/Codelist/cat/codelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode" codeListValue="completed"/>
      </mri:status>
      <mri:topicCategory>
        <mri:MD_TopicCategoryCode>oceans</mri:MD_TopicCategoryCode>
      </mri:topicCategory>

      <mmi:maintenanceNote>
        <gco:CharacterString>Previous metadata record [dataset title: English = Burrard Inlet Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz Deployed 2019-03-28, dataset title: French = Burrard Inlet Profileur Acoustique de Vitesse par Effet Doppler 600 kHz déployé 2019-03-28, abstract: English = The RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) was deployed on 2019-03-28 at Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet is a coastal fjord in southwestern British Columbia. This device is a Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz. Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers (ADCP) are hydroacoustic instruments, similar to sonars. ADCPs measure current speed and direction at multiple predetermined depths simultaneously. ADCPs use the Doppler effect of sound waves that are scattered by particles in seawater over a depth range. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices., abstract: French = Ce RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) a été déployé le 2019-03-28 au Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet est un fjord côtier du sud-ouest de la Colombie-Britannique. Cet instrument est un Profileur Acoustique de Vitesse par Effet Doppler 600 kHz. Les profileurs acoustiques de vitesse par effet Doppler (ADCP) sont des instruments hydroacoustiques, semblables aux sonars. Les ADCP mesurent simultanément la vitesse et la direction du courant à plusieurs profondeurs prédéterminées. Les ADCP utilisent l'effet Doppler des ondes sonores qui sont dispersées par des particules dans l'eau de mer sur une plage de profondeur. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.] differs from current metadata record [dataset title: English = Burrard Inlet Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz Deployed 2019-03-28, dataset title: French = null, abstract: English = The RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) was deployed on 2019-03-28 at Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet is a coastal fjord in southwestern British Columbia. This device is a Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz. Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers (ADCP) are hydroacoustic instruments, similar to sonars. ADCPs measure current speed and direction at multiple predetermined depths simultaneously. ADCPs use the Doppler effect of sound waves that are scattered by particles in seawater over a depth range. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices., abstract: French = null]</gco:CharacterString>

      <mac:instrument>
        <mac:MI_Instrument>
          <mac:identifier>
            <mcc:MD_Identifier>
              <mcc:authority>
                <cit:CI_Citation>

                  </cit:title>
                  <cit:onlineResource>
                    <cit:CI_OnlineResource>

          <mac:type>
            <gco:CharacterString>Teledyne RDI 600kHz Workhorse Monitor direct-reading ADCP</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:type>
          <mac:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>A direct reading acoustic doppler current profiler (ADCP) which provides real-time monitoring of coastal currents typically from a bottom-mounted frame hard-wired to shore. Data is delivered through broadband signal processing, and a four-beam solution provides independent error velocity measurements. The standard depth rating is 200m with up to 6000m available as an option. The instrument operates effectively between temperatures of -5 degC and 45 degC. The 600 kHz ADCP has a velocity accuracy of 0.3% relative to the ADCP water velocity of  +/- 0.3 cm/s.</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:description>
        </mac:MI_Instrument>
      </mac:instrument>
    </mac:MI_AcquisitionInformation>
  </mdb:acquisitionInformation>

name: 9dc9c161-1cb3-45cd-a43c-232075a4b967
notes: The RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) was deployed on 2019-03-28 at Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet is a coastal fjord in southwestern British Columbia. This device is a Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz. Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers (ADCP) are hydroacoustic instruments, similar to sonars. ADCPs measure current speed and direction at multiple predetermined depths simultaneously. ADCPs use the Doppler effect of sound waves that are scattered by particles in seawater over a depth range. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.

notes_translated.en: The RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) was deployed on 2019-03-28 at Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet is a coastal fjord in southwestern British Columbia. This device is a Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz. Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers (ADCP) are hydroacoustic instruments, similar to sonars. ADCPs measure current speed and direction at multiple predetermined depths simultaneously. ADCPs use the Doppler effect of sound waves that are scattered by particles in seawater over a depth range. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.
notes_translated.fr: Ce RDI Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz (SN 25471) a été déployé le 2019-03-28 au Burrard Inlet. Burrard Inlet est un fjord côtier du sud-ouest de la Colombie-Britannique. Cet instrument est un Profileur Acoustique de Vitesse par Effet Doppler 600 kHz. Les profileurs acoustiques de vitesse par effet Doppler (ADCP) sont des instruments hydroacoustiques, semblables aux sonars. Les ADCP mesurent simultanément la vitesse et la direction du courant à plusieurs profondeurs prédéterminées. Les ADCP utilisent l'effet Doppler des ondes sonores qui sont dispersées par des particules dans l'eau de mer sur une plage de profondeur. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.

description_translated.en: The Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System (CIOOS) Pacific is the regional hub of the National CIOOS for ocean data aggregation on Canada’s west coast.
description_translated.fr: Le Système intégré d’observation des océans canadien (SIOOC) Pacifique est la plaque tournante régionale du SIOOC national pour l’agrégation des données océaniques sur la côte ouest du Canada.

title: Burrard Inlet Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz Deployed 2019-03-28

title_translated.en: Burrard Inlet Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler 600 kHz Deployed 2019-03-28

resources.description: Data is delivered via ERDDAP, a data server that gives a standardized way to download subsets of datasets in common file formats. This particular ERDDAP installation has oceanographic data from Ocean Networks Canada's instruments
